conclusion: Analyze the motion of the bullets and the carts
Bullets travel at a constant speed v_0 relative to the ground
Distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air indicates their relative motion
Cart A is moving left with speed v_1
Cart B is moving right with speed v_2
Displacement of bullet relative to Cart B, S_1 = v_0 Δt_0 + v_2 Δt_0
Displacement of Cart A relative to Cart B, S_2 = v_1 Δt_0 + v_2 Δt_0
Relative distance between bullets when they hit the target must be equal to the sum of S_1 and S_2
Simplify to s = (v_0 + v_2 + v_1 + v_2) Δt_0
Rearrange to solve for Δt_0: Δt_0 = s / (v_0 + v_1 + 2v_2)
The time interval between shots, Δt_0, is Δt_0 = s / (v_0 + v_1 + 2v_2)
